snippet: A former Countrywide Financial executive who won a wrongful-dismissal and retaliation case in February 2011 is still waiting for his $3.8 million award.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column relates the case of former Countrywide Financial executive Michael Winston, who won a wrongful-dismissal and retaliation case in February 2011 and is still waiting for his $3.8 million award; points out Bank of America, which bought Countrywide in 2008, is fighting back and has appealed the jury verdict twice.
lead_paragraph: A former Countrywide Financial executive who won a wrongful-dismissal and retaliation case in February 2011 is still waiting for his $3.8 million award.

headline.print_headline: He Felled A Giant, But He Can’t Collect
headline.seo: Countrywide Ex-Executive Still Awaiting $3.8 Million Award
headline.main: He Felled a Giant, but He Can’t Collect
